fields.description: Lucene index in this case just contains 000000000000000.000. Therefore searches performed (like > 3) does not find this issue. Also when extract value from Lucene the value is wrong. Our suggestion is to have validation exclude this value (done trough the check in DoubleConverterImpl.java)
fields.summary: Lucene index contains wrong value when number field is filled with its maximum value - 100,000,000,000,000

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31138].
  {panel}

Currently, when user 'Share' an issue with multiple users, the system generates a dedicated notification email to each user.

'Share' should have an additional option to choose whether to make the multiple users to be disclosed in the notification email. If selected, the system will then generate one email with all the shared users in the To column visible to each other.

As an example, user A 'Share' an issue with user B, C, and D. Currently, B, C and D will get an email each without knowing who else user A shares the information with.
If additional option is enabled, user A 'Share' an issue with user B, C, and D. They will get an email with all B, C and D's email on the To field. They are aware that this information is 'Shared' between them and able to work with each other.
fields.summary: Users should be aware of other users when sharing issues
REST endpoint for issues should have ordering that respects the screen schemes

fields.description:
I would like to describe a date display issue I am encountering.

 

I am using extensively the Created After/Before search method in my filters and reports.

To show the bugs reported today I am using the following setup:
!date1.png!

After that I press Search and get the normal msg Filter modified since loading.

When I go to Summary / Save I get this message:
!date2.png!

And the output of the filter is this:
!date3.png!

The method works if I select the dates that I want and ignore what JIRA displays as modified and I believe other people may get confused if they try to do the filters like this.

My Preferences include Time Zone: (GMT +2) Bucharest if this should be the cause.
fields.summary: Date Display in filter error

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When typing the username really fast on the project role fields (Example: Administrators), the list of suggestion failed.  By failed it means that there are no matches even though the requested user exists.

However, if a user types the username slowly, the suggestion will appear.

h3. Environment
Intermittently reproducible on a customer's JIRA 5.2 and 6.4.1 instance having 8000+ active users, and 5000+ inactive users.

h3. Steps to reproduce
From any Project's Administration page, access the roles tab and try to add a username to a project role typing very fast without pausing

h3. Expected results
JIRA should match the username to relevant user accounts and suggest matching usernames along as you type

h3. Actual results
JIRA is unable to match the username, and displays a "No Matches" message

h3. Notes
The root cause of the issue seems that the http request header is somehow exclude the query it self.  As an example:
{code}
Request URL:http://vmstmsdejira:8080/jira/rest/api/1.0/users/picker?showAvatar=true&query=pascoe&exclude=sanchant&exclude=arupk&exclude=kalbag&exclude=roscorla&exclude=glorim&exclude=jachimj&exclude=meyerj&exclude=junjiequ&exclude=bakoslas&exclude=fidrichl&exclude=phoungl&exclude=powellma&exclude=popem&exclude=mlincoln&exclude=nasserb&exclude=wup&exclude=psnjira&exclude=rajivshu&exclude=richbr&exclude=rling&exclude=augrusot&exclude=veray&exclude=lordw&exclude=yanjunw&exclude=pascoe&_=1357135270028
Request Headersview source
Accept:application/json, text/javascript, */*; q=0.01
Referer:http://vmstmsdejira:8080/jira/plugins/servlet/project-config/RTDEV/roles
User-Agent:Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_7_5) AppleWebKit/537.11 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/23.0.1271.101 Safari/537.11
X-AUSERNAME:
X-Requested-With:XMLHttpRequest
Query String Parametersview URL encoded
showAvatar:true
query:admin
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:xxxx
exclude:admin
_:1357135270028
{code}

I have modified the values of users with xxxx for this example.
fields.summary: Username's suggestion on the Project Role does not display the username when typed quickly

fields.description:
In the General Configuration in 5.2 and later, we have a new item - "Auto-update search results". This has the description, "For supporting criteria, updates search results instantly". 

This description is pretty confusing and really doesn't explain what this setting does and why you would want to turn it on or off.
fields.summary: "Auto-update search results" description in General Configuration is unhelpful

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31129].
  {panel}

* Create a drop-down custom-field with options A, B, and C.
* Create an issue and leave the value for the field as None.
* Edit the settings of the custom field and set default value to C.
* Edit the field config and set the field as required.
* View the issue you previously created - note that the field still has no value.
* Edit this field.

*Actual*: The drop-down is now set to A.

*Expected*: The drop-down should include the "none" value and have this set as its value. (it should fail on validation if the user does not set a value)
(This would be consistent with what happens on Create Issue when a CF is mandatory but has no default.)
fields.summary: Better handling of "none" option in custom field drop-downs during issue update.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31120].
  {panel}

1) Log in as a JIRA administrator
2) Type "gg" and navigate to Permission Helper
3) Enter a user name.
4) Enter an issue key.
5) Select a permission that that user doesn't have for that issue due to not being a member of a group (not a role).

The message says:
{noformat}
<User Name> is not in the <Group Name> group
You can change this by going to <User Name>'s groups admin and adding him to the mentioned group(s)
{noformat}

This assumes that the user is male, which is incorrect for roughly half of our user base.

This should read
You can change this by going to <User Name>'s groups admin and adding *them* to the mentioned group(s)
fields.summary: JIRA admin helper refers to all users as "him" when talking about groups

  {panel}

h4. +Current Scenario+
When searching in the Issue Navigator and ordering by Components or Versions, the returned issues are first ordered by Project and only then alphabetically (in case of the components) or version order; which may lead to a bit of confusion. 

h4. +Suggestion+
* As per [Eric's suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-31113?focusedCommentId=426822&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-426822], we should make the issue navigator sort by component/version directly, and the user should manually specify, e.g.: 'order by project, version', if he wants to sort by project first.
* This behavior should be documented to avoid further confusion - possibly with a note under these fields or a general note on the *ORDER BY* section of the [Advanced Searching|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching] doc.

*Update:* The [Advanced Searching|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-ORDERBY] page was updated to include an info box below the Order By keyword.
fields.summary: Document the Sort Order for Project Fields

h3. Summary: 

The current error displayed for background indexing doesn't always accurately represent the problem with the JIRA instance. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Create a JIRA issue.
# Add a few comments.
# Delete the JIRA issue from {{jiraissue}}. The comments will be orphaned.
# Go to the re-index page.

h3. Expected Results:

JIRA would either handle the orphaned records (in this example, comments) or display a different error.

h3. Actual Results:

The error is displayed, as in the attached screenshot.

h3. Notes:

This can be fixed with modification to the database, as in our [How to Fix the JIRA is Unable to Perform a Background Re-Index at This Time Error|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Fix+the+JIRA+is+Unable+to+Perform+a+Background+Re-Index+at+This+Time+Error] KB.
fields.summary: Provide better error descriptions for the new background indexing functionality

fields.description:
Summary:  
code in JIRA 5.2's jquery.hotkeys.js is not fully handling the case where the event object passed isPlainObject.  It tries dereferencing <event>.combo which is never set in this particular case.  The versions of this code in JIRA 5.0 and 5.1 work properly.

Details:
In a plugin we're developing, we're including a library that calls jQuery.bind to bind an event handler to "keypress".

JIRA's hotkeys JS code has registered an event "add" handler (see jquery.hotkeys.js -- at least in 5.1 source) for "keypress" which gets called to add handling for the custom keypress event registered by the 3rd party library.

The problem is, for the event we're trying to add isPlainObject = true.  This particular case never sets the .combo property on the event before jQuery.map is called passing the .combo property as a key.  Since .combo is undefined, jQuery.map fails with an unhandled JS exception -- specifically within the .map function the attempt to get .length on the first parameter passed (undefined) generates the exception.

Here's the stack trace from JS where things blow up...

e.extend.map (batch.js:525)
(anonymous function) (batch.js:8611)
C (batch.js:8614)
f.event.add (batch.js:1115)
(anonymous function) (batch.js:1301)
e.extend.each (batch.js:483)
e.fn.e.each (batch.js:348)
f.fn.extend.on (batch.js:1300)
f.fn.extend.bind (batch.js:1323)
_fnBindAction (jquery.dataTables.js:2514)
$.extend.full_numbers.fnInit (jquery.dataTables.js:3519)
_fnFeatureHtmlPaginate (jquery.dataTables.js:1505)
_fnAddOptionsHtml (jquery.dataTables.js:914)
_fnInitialise (jquery.dataTables.js:1364)
(anonymous function) (jquery.dataTables.js:3354)
e.extend.each (batch.js:483)
e.fn.e.each (batch.js:348)
DataTable (jquery.dataTables.js:3096)
Arsenale.Dataplane.ReportConfig.decorateTableDataViews (reportConfig.js:41)
(anonymous function) (reportConfig.js:151)
n (batch.js:593)
o.fireWith (batch.js:638)
w (batch.js:2498)
d (batch.js:2667)

where the exception is happening in JIRA's jquery.hotkeys.js...

function C(G) {
if (!(D.isPlainObject(G.data) || D.isArray(G.data) || typeof G.data === "string")) { return }
var F = G.handler, E = {timer: 700};
(function(H) {
if (typeof H === "string") { E.combo = [H] } else {
if (D.isArray(H)) { E.combo = H } else { D.extend(E, H) }
}
E.combo = D.map(E.combo, function(I) { <============= E.combo undefined when D.isPlainObject
 return I.toLowerCase() })
})(G.data);

fields.description:
We use jira and confluence on two virtual hosts: jira.letv.cn, wiki.letv.cn .

Add a page on conflunece, that included a blog list, save the page.

On the jira activity stream, the editor's link in list title is "http://testwiki.letv.cn/display/~<username>", it's correct. But the editor's link in the content is "http://testjira.letv.cn/display/~<username>", it's wrong.
I think it's a bug, Please check.
fields.summary: activity stream bug on multi virtual hosts

h4. Steps to replicate

This behaviour can be observed on the following video:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/82195/usernameIE8.swf

----

|(x)|Cannot Reproduce|

Test on all browsers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31083].
  {panel}

Since *JIRA 5.0*, the usage of the dialog box was introduced to allow users create and edit issues and sub-tasks quicker where the aim to this feature is that you do not need to leave the current page or have it reload just to start creating or editing an issue or sub-tasks as per the following documentation:
* [JIRA 5.0 Rapidly create and edit issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+5.0+Release+Notes#JIRA5.0ReleaseNotes-customisabledialogbox].

However, users would like to implement the usage of Virgil together with *JIRA 5.0* and unfortunately, the dialog box does not cater for this. Virgil will work normally if we use the normal *Create Issue* screen instead of the dialog box. A question was raised in [Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/] to address this concern as per the following:
* [Virgil with JIRA 5|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/46967/virgil-with-jira-5]

Are there any updates on this feature whether Virgil will be made available to work well with the dialog box feature? It will be really useful to have this looked at.

fields.description:
Just for convenience: if you establish an application link between JIRA and Confluence and use an explicit port declaration (e.g. https://wiki.blah.tld:443 instead of https://wiki.blah.tld) the linking of JIRA issues to wiki pages fail.
If you mention a JIRA issue inside your Confluence, the JIRA issue itself contains only the information: "You have no permission to view this wiki page". Manual search of wiki entries inside an issue is not possible. You will receive no warning or errors, just an empty result set.

confluence/logs/catalina.out contains the following line:
{code}
2012-12-23 14:17:35,202 WARN [http-8082-4] [auth.trustedapps.filter.TrustedApplicationFilterAuthenticator] authenticate Failed to login trusted application: jira:6281431 due to bad URL signature.
{code}

This issue was already mentioned in BAM-11309 and https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/TRUST-31 but is a generic problem with application linking.

Resolution: Remove the port from the application link URL.

I filled this issue to help any other users having the same problem and searching only for JIRA/Confluence.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31062].
  {panel}

It seems to be not possible to skip the weekends when trying to run a query to search for issues due 'X' days in the future. Even being able to edit within the 'Time Tracking' how many days a week has and how many hours per day.

Scenario:

If I run a query to find all issues of a project that must be done until the next day, I'll have to search for issues with *endOfDay("+1")*. However, when I reach Friday and run the same query, it will try get issues that must be done until Saturday, thus I'll have to edit the query filter to *endOfDay("+3")* to get Monday.

We should be able to skip the weekend since we had configured the 'Time Tracking' to 5 days per week.
fields.summary: Ability to skip weekends when using endOfDay() function

  {panel}

When Trying to project Import from an OnDemand XML backup, the following error is thrown:
{noformat}
Cause:
java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: [GenericEntity.set] "zip" is not a field of FileAttachment
Stack Trace: [hide]
java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: [GenericEntity.set] "zip" is not a field of FileAttachment
at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerGet(FutureTask.java:222)
at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(FutureTask.java:83)
at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskDescriptorImpl.getResult(TaskDescriptorImpl.java:113)
at com.atlassian.jira.web.bean.TaskDescriptorBean.getResult(TaskDescriptorBean.java:73)
{noformat}

This is because the latest OnDemand version is 6.0 while JIRA is still 5.2.x, and project import only works when the XML backup and the JIRA version is the same.  It would be convenient for our users to be able to do project import from OnDemand XML backup to BTF JIRA regardless of the OnDemand version.

----

Another improvement would be to modify the Error Message, perhaps displaying "Unable to do Project Import due to the conflicting version between the instance and the XML backup"
fields.summary: Project Import from OnDemand XML backup to JIRA BTF throws the exception java.lang.illegalargumentexception

There seems to be some kind of caching going on with linking issues.  Here is what I found:

Create a new issue
Navigate to an older issue (the one I used was about 3 months old)
Choose More Actions-->Link issue
in the dialog use the pull down and select the issue just created
Click link
You get a message that you need to link to an existing issue

Go back to the issue just entered
choose More Actions-->Link issue
in the dialog use the pull down to select the issue you were just looking at
Click link
everything is fine

I'm also attaching screenshots that I took when I was having the problem

fields.description:
ChangeHistoryFieldIdResolver keeps a cache of version names to the IDs that match that name.  This class doesn't register for any events, and there is no way to clear the reference, so this cache can become stale if a change is made that involves a name that has previously been searched for.  Examples include deleting a version, renaming it, or creating a new version that has the same name.

It is only used for history searches, so the impact is restricted to the WAS and CHANGED operators, not to version searching in general.
fields.summary: ChangeHistoryFieldIdResolver has an ill-behaved cache that never clears

fields.description:
h3. Summary: 

When moving a parent issue, if it has subtasks with custom field values that have different contexts in the source and target project, they will not be validated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Create Custom Field with different contexts for Project A & Project B (as in the attached screenshot).
# Create Issue in Project A with one value in the Custom Field (e.g.: create it in Llama with option D).
# Create a sub-task of that issue with the same value for the custom field.
# Move the parent issue to Project B (e.g.: Goose).

h3. Expected Results:

The custom field context validation is applied to the subtask and will not be allowed to move it as a value of D (as this does not exist within the context for the target project).

h3. Actual Results:

The subtask is moved with the same value in the custom field, so it is using the context of the previous project (e.g.: Llama).
fields.summary: Moving a subtask with its parent does not validate the custom field context

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31021].
  {panel}

h3. Summary: 

Please improve JIRA so that when moving an issue from one project to another, if there is a custom field with different contexts for each project it will retain that value. Currently it does not.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Create Custom Field with different contexts for Project A & Project B (as in the attached screenshot).
# Create Issue in Project A with one value in the Custom Field.
# Bulk Move the issue to Project B.
# Select the retain check box and complete the move.

h3. Expected Results:

The value would be retained.

h3. Actual Results:

The value is not retained.

h3. Notes:

This happens for both move and bulk move, however move never offers the retain option. It is possible that the context for the target project will not have the same options as the source project - I'm unsure how to suggest best handling of this.
fields.summary: Retain values for a custom field with different contexts when moving the issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31014].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian,

We have noticed that a project administrator is able to change his project's lead.

This is a security problem in our opinion since the permission scheme grants special rights (e.g. Delete issue) only to the project admin. This can be bypassed by any administrator today and violates our security policies!

Also our project charging is based on the project leads cost center, so the charging could be faked to a dummy account.

If there were some trace regarding the administrators activities the impact for us would not be that high. But the way it is now, is a real security issue for us!

So we suggest to let just the project lead or jira administrator change the project lead. Or at least have some permission "Change project lead" would also help.

Please consider fixing this soon! We have customers that have already complained about this.

Regards,
Dieter
fields.summary: Add new permission level for changing project lead
